description: PulsarFunction is the Schema for the pulsar functions API

apiVersion.description:
APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object.
Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and
may reject unrecognized values.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description:
Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents.
Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to.
Cannot be updated.
In CamelCase.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: PulsarFunctionSpec defines the desired state of PulsarFunction

autoAck.description: AutoAck is the flag to indicate whether the function should auto ack

batchBuilder.description: BatchBuilder is the batch builder that the function uses

className.description: ClassName is the class name of the function

cleanupSubscription.description: CleanupSubscription is the flag to indicate whether the subscription should be cleaned up when the function is deleted

connectionRef.description: ConnectionRef is the reference to the PulsarConnection resource

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
TODO: Add other useful fields. apiVersion, kind, uid?
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names
TODO: Drop `kubebuilder:default` when controller-gen doesn't need it https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/kubebuilder/issues/3896.

customRuntimeOptions.description: CustomRuntimeOptions is the custom runtime options of the function

customSchemaInputs.description: CustomSchemaInputs is the custom schema inputs of the function

customSchemaOutputs.description: CustomSchemaOutputs is the custom schema outputs of the function

customSerdeInputs.description: CustomSerdeInputs is the custom serde inputs of the function

deadLetterTopic.description: DeadLetterTopic is the dead letter topic of the function

exposePulsarAdminClientEnabled.description: ExposePulsarAdminClientEnabled is the flag to indicate whether the function should expose pulsar admin client

forwardSourceMessageProperty.description: ForwardSourceMessageProperty is the flag to indicate whether the function should forward source message properties

go.description: Go is the go of the function

additionalProperties.description: ConsumerConfig represents the configuration for the consumer of the pulsar functions and connectors

cryptoConfig.description: CryptoConfig represents the configuration for the crypto of the pulsar functions and connectors

inputSpecs.description: InputSpecs is the input specs of the function

inputTypeClassName.description: InputTypeClassName is the input type class name of the function

inputs.description: Inputs is the inputs of the function

jar.description: Jar is the jar of the function

lifecyclePolicy.description:
PulsarResourceLifeCyclePolicy defines the behavior for managing Pulsar resources
when the corresponding custom resource (CR) is deleted from the Kubernetes cluster.
This policy allows users to control whether Pulsar resources should be retained or
removed from the Pulsar cluster after the CR is deleted.

logTopic.description: LogTopic is the log topic of the function

maxMessageRetries.description: MaxMessageRetries is the max message retries of the function

maxPendingAsyncRequests.description: MaxPendingAsyncRequests is the max pending async requests of the function

name.description: Name is the name of the function

namespace.description: Namespace is the namespace of the function

output.description: Output is the output of the function

outputSchemaType.description: OutputSchemaType is the output schema type of the function

outputSerdeClassName.description: OutputSerdeClassName is the output serde class name of the function

outputTypeClassName.description: OutputTypeClassName is the output type class name of the function

parallelism.description: Parallelism is the parallelism of the function

processingGuarantees.description: ProcessingGuarantees is the processing guarantees of the function

producerConfig.description: ProducerConfig is the producer config of the function

cryptoConfig.description: CryptoConfig represents the configuration for the crypto of the pulsar functions and connectors

py.description: Py is the py of the function

resources.description: Resources is the resources of the function

retainKeyOrdering.description: RetainKeyOrdering is the flag to indicate whether the function should retain key ordering

retainOrdering.description: RetainOrdering is the flag to indicate whether the function should retain ordering

runtimeFlags.description: RuntimeFlags is the runtime flags of the function

additionalProperties.description: FunctionSecretKeyRef indicates a secret name and key

secrets.description: Secrets is the secrets of the function

skipToLatest.description: SkipToLatest is the flag to indicate whether the function should skip to latest

subName.description: SubName is the sub name of the function

subscriptionPosition.description: SubscriptionPosition is the subscription position of the function

tenant.description: Tenant is the tenant of the function

timeoutMs.description: TimeoutMs is the function timeout in milliseconds

topicsPattern.description: TopicsPattern is the topics pattern that the function subscribes to

userConfig.description: UserConfig is the user config of the function

windowConfig.description: WindowConfig is the window config of the function

status.description: PulsarFunctionStatus defines the observed state of PulsarFunction

conditions.description: Represents the observations of a connection's current state.

lastTransitionTime.description:
lastTransitionTime is the last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.
This should be when the underlying condition changed.  If that is not known, then using the time when the API field changed is acceptable.

message.description:
message is a human readable message indicating details about the transition.
This may be an empty string.

observedGeneration.description:
observedGeneration represents the .metadata.generation that the condition was set based upon.
For instance, if .metadata.generation is currently 12, but the .status.conditions[x].observedGeneration is 9, the condition is out of date
with respect to the current state of the instance.

reason.description:
reason contains a programmatic identifier indicating the reason for the condition's last transition.
Producers of specific condition types may define expected values and meanings for this field,
and whether the values are considered a guaranteed API.
The value should be a CamelCase string.
This field may not be empty.

status.description: status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

type.description:
type of condition in CamelCase or in foo.example.com/CamelCase.
---
Many .condition.type values are consistent across resources like Available, but because arbitrary conditions can be
useful (see .node.status.conditions), the ability to deconflict is important.
The regex it matches is (dns1123SubdomainFmt/)?(qualifiedNameFmt)

observedGeneration.description:
ObservedGeneration is the most recent generation observed for this resource.
It corresponds to the metadata generation, which is updated on mutation by the API Server.
